questions.question: Where is the ancient ruin located that once served as the political and spiritual heart of the Khmer Empire, and also listed as a UNESCO site?
questions.context: This site is famed for its largest religious monument and intricate bas-relief carvings, constructed in the early 12th century.

questions.question: What is the name of the capital city that became the center of the Inca Empire and is now a UNESCO World Heritage Site?
questions.context: Originally built by the Inca ruler Pachacuti, this city serves as a gateway to the Sacred Valley and Machu Picchu.

questions.question: Can you identify the site that served as the birthplace of Democracy in Ancient Greece and houses several remarkable ancient ruins?
questions.context: Among its ruins is the Parthenon, which was constructed in the 5th century BC and dedicated to the goddess Athena.

questions.question: Identify the ancient ruins, constructed circa 3200 BC, which once served as a ceremonial site in the Northern Hemisphere.
questions.context: This prehistoric monument is older than Stonehenge and the Great Pyramids, known for its alignment with the winter solstice.

questions.question: Which UNESCO site, located on the Yucat√°n Peninsula, was a major focal point of ancient Maya civilization?
questions.context: Featuring the pyramid of El Castillo, this archaeological site is one of the New Seven Wonders of the World, renowned for its ball court and astronomical precision.
